page.title: 12BURNT HOUSE FARM INTERVIEW
page.content: The owner Mr.Reed bought the farm in 1953 along with 5.5 acres of land and he here the same year after working in the Argentine.The land was originally used for apple growing,but is now used by Mr.Cross of Whitehouse farm for growing wheat and barley. Mr.Reed is now 81 years old.He lives on a pension of 26 pounds 34 pence per week and he also recieves 25 pence a week heating supplement,this pays for 4 hours of a 1 bar electric fire.He feels that Whitnesham is a healthy place to live,but that the Winters are often bad.
